messages: dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (03:25): anyone confirm that raidz2 is on 42a?  LU'n to it now, but I want to use raidz2 on the box "hopefully" :)
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:26): Morning, all
f2b248ffb6592bff3a0225b9899828e6 (03:26): i read something about raidz2s available but cant remember which build it was :|
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:27): just a moment, I'll check
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:28): 6417978 double parity RAID-Z a.k.a. RAID6 .... listed as integrated into snv_42
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:29): jmcpAtSun: Morning. Did you and Tpenta come to any decisions about SOSUG?
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:29): hi. kinda ... next week when you're in town sounds best
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:29): Tpenta was going to send out an announcement ......
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:31): boyd: SUNWCuser is just the end-user cluster, right>?
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:31): jmcpAtSun: I believe so... gimme 1 min I have the doc here on the desk
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:32): Yep SUNWCuser is "End User"
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:32): No man pages, remember

f2b248ffb6592bff3a0225b9899828e6 (03:33): q: when i got a server with one slice used for the root fs .. is it possible to setup using the rest capacity of the hdd for zfs without access to the server console (so only using ssh)?
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:33): You mean you want to shrink root?
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:33): boyd: yeah ... gha
f2b248ffb6592bff3a0225b9899828e6 (03:33): (trying to figure out if im able to use opensol on my next dedi)
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:33): no, I'm wandering around a box that somebody has logged a bug against ... they only have SUNWCuser installed :(

f2b248ffb6592bff3a0225b9899828e6 (03:34): dont want to shrink the root (but it would be also cute to be able to do this) - just need the rest of my first hdd also for the zfs mirror - the machine got only 2 hdds available
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (03:35): thx jmcpAtSun had to check dinner, it was cooking......
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:35): Cybernd: Ok, so you currently have an installed OS on root and it's not taking the whole disk?
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:35): jlc: you're welcome
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:35): and you want to know if you can use the rest for zfs?
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:35): jlc: now if I only had enough disks available to use it too
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:35): jmcpAtSun: Did you see Glenn Brunette's SPC tool?
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:36): boyd: goodness me, it's Glenn's SPC tool. .....
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (03:36): i have 6x250gb going to see how it turns out once this LU is done
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:36): jlc: oh, the photos? hav fun
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:37): boyd: thanks, they were getting a bit long

f2b248ffb6592bff3a0225b9899828e6 (03:37): boyd currently i have nothing ;P but i need to figure out what i need to tell the technican when he initial installs the os - so i thought when i tell him that he should install the basic os on a 10gig slice should be enough - would use the rest 150gig as zfs mirror slice; just dont know if its possible to do this
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (03:37): zpool create zfs raidz2 c0d0 c1d0 c2d0 c3d0 c7d0 c8d0
dcf5500c7e53721d4b016e4793d5dd66 (03:37): I assume thats all i need to do

d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:38): Cybernd: Yep, that's fine. IT's easiest if he creates a slice to cover the rest of the disk at install time. You'll then use that for zfs. Don't forget a slice for swap
f2b248ffb6592bff3a0225b9899828e6 (03:40): boyd okay then i will try to figure out a suitable slice setup and he should create all slices and not only the slices for the basic setup
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:40): Cybernd: sure. There is unlikely to be a need for more than one slice for the zfs stuff
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:40): jmcpAtSun: This is what I meant: http://blogs.sun.com/roller/page/gbrunett?entry=solaris_package_companion
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (03:40): anyone knows if I can use the USB ports on the back of 5310 NAS for serial console since there is no RS232 serial port
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:41): boyd: that's *neat*
33ed8c96b2b06385e426e5bcf6935cf8 (03:41): I like it

f2b248ffb6592bff3a0225b9899828e6 (03:41): boyd im rather new with opensol :| i still hope that its possible to install openSol on my dedi - quite hard to figure out the compatibility without a live test. thx for your feedback
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:41): jmcpAtSun: LeftWing and I were chatting on Fri about writing something like that, and then like 2 minutes later I read about that tool in my RSS reader :)
d1ecb99b19140444b80e4035bfe0dd67 (03:42): Cybernd: np

b8ac460f16efd92d9e259415a4930199 (04:33): how can you even consider writing an irc client with only a shellscript
